page.title: 01Lesmahagow & Nethan Valley
page.content: The River Nethan and the valley through which it flows is the predominent feature of the area, the old village of Lesmahagow nestles in a curve on the Western bank of the River Valley, which now extends over the lower western slopes and on a plateau to the south. The A74,Glasgow-Carlisle road, curently being upgraded to motorway standard, bypasses the village. The area contains no major industries over two third of the are is agricultural land, many of the working population having to commute. Local employment is confined to shops, offices, agriculture, small factory, units and hospital. Unemployment gives cause for concern. The 12th century priory site is the principle tourist feature.
